RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. INNER TURF (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOTED forwardly placed from the gate, raced just off the inside through the first turn before settling three wide down the backstretch to prompt the leader from the outside, tucked to the two path seven-sixteenths from home, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong out, shook off the former leader a sixteenth out when confronted by the runner up and dug in game to rebuff that challenge to the wire. SPIRIT PRINCE coaxed from the gate, tracked the pace just off the inside until tucked inside at the seven-sixteenths, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch and closed well to secure the place honors latching on the winner as he hit the finish. FORTUNE SELLER coaxed from the start, showed the way in hand along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under threat and was caught a furlong out, fought on running on inside to secure the show honors clear of the rest. ASK ISAAC grew rank under restraint from the seven-eighths marker into the first turn nearly tossing the rider from the saddle when spinning off the rail to the two path and forcing BACK BAYOU three wide into that turn, settled just off the inside into the backstretch and tracked the front from near the rear, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. NOBLE WAVE broke out a step at the start and was corrected, tracked the front just off the inside until tipped three wide at the half mile pole, came under coaxing at the three-eighths and offered up a bid at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and weakened. UNCLE BO broke out a step at the start bumping BACK BAYOU, chased along the inside under coaxing from three furlongs out, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened. BACK BAYOU bumped at the start by UNCLE BO, raced just off the inside early on until nudged three wide into the first turn by a rank ASK ISAAC, chased along the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, cut the corner into upper stretch and trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Ask Isaac
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank 7/8 into 1st trn, tracked 2p, coaxed 3/8, 7w uppr, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Spirit Prince
ENTRY.OWNER: Oakwood Stables (Daniel J Burke) Krase Scott D Donarra Thoroughbreds LLC Beitz K
ENTRY.COMMENT: coax st, tracked 2p, to ins 7/16,ins turn, 3-4w uppr, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Fortune Seller
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, coaxed near 1/4, 2w 1/4p, caught, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Noble Wave
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, tracked 2p, tip 3w 1/2, coaxed 3/8, 5w upper, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Bo
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out step st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Back Bayou
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, nudged 3w into 1st trn, track ins, cut corner, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Noted
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p 1st turn, prompted 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 3w uppr, up 1/8, game

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 91. Starter Allowance Purse 70000. (UP TO $12,180 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PADDINGTON was bumped lightly after the start, went to the front, opened up a clear advantage in the two path, was challenged with a half-mile to run, vied in the two path while inside of a foe on the far turn, shook off that rival near the five-sixteenths, extended the advantage while shaken up into upper stretch, was put to a left-handed crop outside the furlong marker, remained under the crop until outside the sixteenth-pole then was placed under a hand-ride before being eased up late while much the best. WHAT'S UP DOC went three wide on the first turn, settled comfortably on the outside, moved closer midway down the backstretch, was asked with a half-mile to run, chased in the four path through the far turn and proved no match for the winner while able to get the place. DEPUTY CONNECT broke out then was corrected with a snatch of the left-rein, saved ground on the first turn, tracked the clear leader while off the rail on the backstretch, gained to make a bid at the half-mile pole, vied in the three path under urging on the far turn, lost touch with the winner late on that bend and weakened but was well clear for the show. HANG TIGHT broke out at the start, settled on the inside, was urged along on the far turn, came three wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. CENTAVO acted-up just before the starters button was pushed, charged the front of the gate, had his head turned when the stall opened, was in the hands of the assistant starter a moment longer then the rest of the field as he tried to lend assistance, came out a few lengths behind the front, rounded the first turn in the two path, settled at the back, was urged two then three wide on the far turn, dropped to the two path into the stretch and failed to respond then was declared a non-starter post race. INSPEIGHTOFTRAINER was forced out at the start then taken up while shut-off, dropped from three to two wide on the first turn, settled towards the back, was urged along in the two path on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch and also failed to respond. FOLLOWING A STEWARDS' INQUIRY INTO THE START, CENTAVO WAS DECLARED A NON-STARTER

ENTRY.NAME: Hang Tight
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,settled inside,urged 2nd turn,3w1/4,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Deputy Connect
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,corrected,ins1st,tracked,bid1/2,3w2nd turn,wknd,clr3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Inspeightoftrainer
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out brk,shut-off,tkn up,2-3path turns,5w1/4,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Paddington
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bmp aftr brk,2p,clr pace,shook foe5/16,drw off,easd up late

ENTRY.NAME: Centavo
ENTRY.COMMENT: acted-up brk,charged gate,head-turned,off slw,2-3p turns,empty

ENTRY.NAME: What's Up Doc
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w1st,settled outside,closer5/8,ask1/2,chsd 4p2nd turn,no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 5 1/2F Turf CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Pre ferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPOOKY LADY coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under threat to the outside and held stubbornly to the finish. VOLEUSE chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, got lightly coaxed along swinging three wide into upper stretch before being roused with three-sixteenths to go, rallied to issue a challenge inside the final furlong but was ultimately repelled to the end. CERRETTA chased four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, offered up a bid a furlong out, then ran on to secure the show honors. SHAMAN PRINCESS stumbled at the start recovering outwards, raced hard held five paths off the inside from the five-eighths to the nine-sixteenths, went four then three wide into the turn before tucking quickly to the inside near the five-sixteenths, spun three wide into upper stretch and passed tired rivals to the finish. BUSSIA chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, weakened. ADMIRE MY CROWN four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing five-sixteenths from home, angled six wide into upper stretch and tired. LADY FORTUNA chased along the inside coming under coaxing with seven-sixteenths to go, tipped to the two path through the turn, went two to three wide into upper stretch and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Bussia
ENTRY.OWNER: Bond Racing Stable and Counter Point Thoroughbreds LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, angled 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Cerretta
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w backstretch, 2p turn, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, bid, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Spooky Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 2p, ins turn, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4, stubbornly

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Fortuna
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, coaxed 7/16, 2p turn, 2-3w upper, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Voleuse
ENTRY.OWNER: Harris Susan T and CC Crimson
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, ins turn, 3w upper, roused 3/16, rallied, repelled

ENTRY.NAME: Admire My Crown
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 6w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Shaman Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st,hard held 5w 5/8-9/16, to ins 5/16, 3w uppr, by tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 88. Claiming Purse 45000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WINNING CONNECTION was hustled from the gate, went five then four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, gained to make a bid leaving the backstretch, took the lead in the three path midway through the far turn, shook clear outside the quarter-pole, came under a left-handed crop outside the sixteenth-pole, shortened stride while remaining clear into the final sixteenth and held under strong urging. YONO came out just after the start and bumped with a foe, settled on the inside, was roused late on the backstretch, chased inside early on the far then then shifted three wide, was driven five wide into the stretch then moved out a bit more, kept on well in the final furlong, gained on the winner into the final sixteenth but missed while able to get the place. BOYS CODE went three wide on the first turn, raced with her his head cocked late on that bend, settled off the pace, chased three then four wide on the far turn, spun five wide into the stretch under a drive, kept on in pursuit of the winner in the final furlong, gained into the final sixteenth and willingly earned the show. BREAK THE ICE went around the first turn in the two path, settled at the rear, saved ground under urging on the far turn, swung six wide into upper stretch and improved position. HUSBAND MATERIAL bobbled at the start then was bumped, dropped from the two path to the rail on the first turn, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside on the far turn, was headed at the three-eighths pole, dropped back outside the quarter-pole and tired. STRONG LIGHT came outward while breaking a bit awkwardly and was off a step slow, went five wide on the first turn, floated out onto the backstretch, settled on the outside, was urged along in the two path on the far turn and was no factor. ACHILLES HEEL was hustled from the gate, went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, passed the five-eighths under urging, dropped back four wide on the far turn and capitulated. INSPECTOR was hustled from the start, dropped from the four path to the two path on the first turn, tracked the pace on the outside under coaxing, made a bid under urging leaving the backstretch, vied in the two path on the far turn, dropped back outside the quarter-pole and had nothing left.

ENTRY.NAME: Yono
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd after brk,settled ins,ask1/2,3w5/16,5w1/4,gained late,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Husband Material
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled brk,bmpd,2p-ins1st,pace,ins2nd,headed3/8,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Break the Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st turn,at back,ins2nd turn,6w into lane,improved

ENTRY.NAME: Boys Code
ENTRY.OWNER: Dixon Linda K and Alejandro Hector M
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st,head-cocked6-1/2,settled,chsd 3-4w2nd,5w1/4,willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Inspector
ENTRY.OWNER: MyRacehorse and Bloom Racing Stable LLC (Jeffrey Bloom)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-2p1st,tracked outside,urged1/2,bid7/16,2p 2nd turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Achilles Heel
ENTRY.OWNER: Nicholas Racing Stable and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,4w1st,settled outside,empty 4w2nd turn,capitulated

ENTRY.NAME: Winning Connection
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5-4p1st,settled out,bid7/16,3p2nd,clear1/4,shortened stride,held

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk bit awkward,step slow,5w1st,out,2p2nd turn,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNDERVALUED ASSET three wide in pursuit, advanced on the top pair five-sixteenths from home, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and was roused straightened away, took over command with three-sixteenths to go, inched clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in and held safe coming inwards in the final strides to the wire. CUPID'S HEART broke out at the start bumping with DEAR LADY and took the worst of it getting away last and conceding four lengths to the front, chased along the inside advancing under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. ZEITLOS prompted the pace from the two path under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and weakened in the late stages. HUNTRESS FOR HIRE coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside under pressure from ZEITLOS to the outside, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and took the inside route into upper stretch, got collared at the three-sixteenths, weakened in the late going. DEAR LADY three wide in pursuit, got coaxed along at the seven-sixteenths, continued three wide into upper stretch and weakened. TO A T chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, made no impact. VIENNA CODE bobbled at the break conceding three lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased three to four wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, continued three to four wide into upper stretch and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Undervalued Asset
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, advanced 5/16, 3-4w upper, up 3/16, clear, safe

ENTRY.NAME: Cupid's Heart
ENTRY.OWNER: Flying P Stable and R A Hill Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out, bumped st, chased inside, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Dear Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Fowler Barry and Magdalena Racing (Sherri McPeek)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 7/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Vienna Code
ENTRY.OWNER: Williams Andrew O and Inniss Lenox
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, chased 3-4w, coaxed 7/16, 3-4w upper, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: To a T
ENTRY.OWNER: Zilla Racing Stables Acqua Nova Stable and PlayingTheField Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Huntress for Hire
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, ins 1/4, caught 3/16, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Zeitlos
ENTRY.OWNER: Stonestreet Stables LLC and Leidel Peter
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 2p, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, dug in, weakened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Caress S. - Grade3 SARATOGA RACE 6 5 1/2F Turf CR: 103. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROSES FOR DEBRA broke out then brushed with a foe, was placed under a tight hold early, stalked the pace on the outside, was let out in the three path on the turn then asked at the quarter-pole, rallied to the lead under a strong hand-ride coming to the furlong marker, was given one pop of a right-handed crop while moving clear inside that marker and proved best under a brisk hand-ride to the finish. WAKANAKA (IRE) was hustled from the gate, settled on the outside, went four wide on the turn, was roused at the five-sixteenths, chased outside in the stretch and narrowly earned the place while no match for the winner. BUBBLE ROCK went to the front, showed the way on an uncontested lead, went around the turn in the two path, was asked at the quarter-pole then came under a drive in upper stretch, lost the advantage to the winner approaching the quarter-pole and weakened then lost the place but narrowly held the show. POPPY FLOWER was brushed at the start and carried out some, settled at the rear, went two then three wide on the turn, came under mild urging late on that bend, was roused five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed kick then just missed the show. OUR FLASH DRIVE stumbled awkwardly at the start and was last to commence, moved up under coaxing to race just off the pace, saved ground on the turn, moved off the rail while asked for her best in upper stretch and also lacked the needed kick. THE QUARTER-MILE FRACTION WAS HAND TIMED.

ENTRY.NAME: Our Flash Drive
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled awkwardly brk,mvd up,ins,2p3/16,chased,no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Bubble Rock
ENTRY.COMMENT: went to front,easy pace,2p turn,ask1/4,headed1/8,wknd,lost 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Roses for Debra
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,brshd,tight hold,stlkd out,3p,ask1/4,lead1/8,edgd clear

ENTRY.NAME: Poppy Flower
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed brk,carried out,settled,2-3p turn,roused 5w1/4,missed 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Wakanaka (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Team Valor International and Barber, Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,settled outside,4w turn,ask5/16,chased,up for place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VALENTINE CANDY got away to a sharp start opening up two to three lengths in the first trio of jumps from the gate, showed the way in hand two to three wide down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn through swift splits patiently handled until set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under growing late threat and held well and safe to the finish kept to task. PROTECTIVE chased four paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung six wide into upper stretch and closed well outside to get up for the place honors latching on the winner as he hit the wire. ANNOINTED got bumped at the start by DIVE BOMBER breaking inwards, chased just off the inside early on before tipping four wide at the nine-sixteenths, continued four wide through the turn under coaxing from the half mile pole, went seven wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly to secure the show honors. GENERAL PARTNER broke out at the start brushing the off side stall and then got bumped by SOCIETY MAN, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch and ran on to the finish willingly but was out-finished in the late stages. DIVE BOMBER broke inwards brushing the near side stall at the start, then bumped ANNOINTED just prior to getting bumped by WORLD FAIR coming in from his outside, chased just off the inside down the backstretch before tipping four wide through the turn placed to coaxing seven-sixteenths from home, continued four wide into upper stretch and ran on through to the finish but was out-finished in the late going. DANCING GROOM coaxed from the start, chased just off the inside under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, angled out three to four wide into upper stretch and offered no response. SOCIETY MAN broke in at the start bumping GENERAL PARTNER, chased along the inside down the backstretch before tipping two to three wide through the turn getting placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, continued two to three wide into upper stretch and made no impact. DAILY GRIND broke out at the start hitting the off side stall and getting away last conceding five lengths to the front, chased inside briefly climbing under the kickback and was tipped out five wide to clearance nine-sixteenths from home, went four wide through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung seven to eight wide into upper stretch and made no impact. WORLD FAIR lunged slightly at the start and recovered inwards bumping with DIVE BOMBER, chased three then two wide under coaxing from three furlongs out, cornered just off the inside into upper stretch and tired. TRUCKER coaxed from the gate, chased four then three wide under coaxing from midway on the turn, went four wide at the head of the stretch and faltered in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Society Man
ENTRY.OWNER: West Paces Racing LLC Gargan Danny and GMP Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased inside, coaxed 2-3w 3/8, 2-3w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Daily Grind
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate st, ins briefly, tip 5w 9/16,4w turn,7-8w uppr,no impact

ENTRY.NAME: General Partner
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, bumped st, chased ins, coaxed 5/16, 3w uppr, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Dancing Groom
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 7/16, 3-4w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Valentine Candy
ENTRY.OWNER: Heiligbrodt L William Heiligbrodt Corinne Jackpot Farm Whispering Oaks Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: sharp st, in hand 2-3w, set down 2w 1/4p, edged clear, held well

ENTRY.NAME: Annointed
ENTRY.OWNER: Siena Farm LLC and WinStar Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, 2p early, tip 4w 9/16, coaxed 1/2, 7w uppr, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Dive Bomber
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, bumped 2x st, chased 2p, 4w turn, 4w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: World Fair
ENTRY.COMMENT: slight lunge st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Protective
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w backstretch, 2p turn, coaxed 7/16, 6w upper, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Trucker
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, faltered

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 99. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 149500. INNER TURF (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At Any Distance Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At TimeO f Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAKING CANDY brushed the outside of the gate while hustled, saved ground while well placed just off the pace, was asked in the two path into the stretch, rallied to the lead inside the three-sixteenths, led under a drive into the final sixteenth, lost the advantage one stride from the wire but won the head-bob on the line and gamely prevailed. SCRAMBLE saved ground on the first turn, was reserved in the middle of the field, moved from the rail to the two path on the far turn, swung five wide into upper stretch then was roused, remained on his inside lead while rallying outside coming to the furlong marker, swapped to the proper lead inside that marker, closed strongly to draw even with the winner a few strides from the finish, led one stride from the wire but was out-nodded and denied but earned the place. MERCANTE angled in towards the rear, rounded the first turn in the two path, settled at the rear, moved from the two path to the three path while roused on the far turn, swung six wide into upper stretch, rallied outside into the final furlong and finished with good energy to garner the show. I'M VERY BUSY was away awkwardly, saved ground while reserved towards the back, came off the rail while roused into upper stretch, gained into a reasonable striking position and improved position but lacked the needed kick. ANTARES was hustled to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the advantage under a drive in upper stretch, fought with the winner into the final furlong and gave way. FEARLESS SOLDIER navigated the first turn in the two path, stalked the pace on the outside, was asked with a half-mile to run, chased in the two path on the far turn, spun three wide into the stretch and came up empty. WICO (IRE) traveled around the first turn in the two path, was rated in fourth position, went two then three wide on the far turn, was driven four wide into the stretch, chased into the final furlong and also came up empty. GRAND GIOMAR STEP (IRE) was taken in hand early, tugged at the bit under tight restraint in the three path through the first turn, was reserved on the outside, went three wide while roused on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. HARRINGTON moved in towards the back early, rounded the first turn in the two path, settled towards the rear, went around the far turn in the two path, came three wide into the stretch and failed to threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Very Busy
ENTRY.OWNER: Team Hanley Schermerhorn Richard and Braverman Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward brk,reserved inside,mvd out 3/16,improved

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Giomar Step (IRE)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of CHY

ENTRY.OWNER: Schermerhorn Richard Madaket Stables LLC and LaPenta Robert V
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand,pulled3p1st,outside,3w2nd,5w1/4,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Antares
ENTRY.OWNER: Mathiesen Mark Williams Latham Polger Lorne and Hall Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,inside pace,asked1/4,headed inside 3/16,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Taking Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: hstld,well plcd ins,ask2p1/4,bid3/16,lead outside1/8,game,won bob

ENTRY.NAME: Scramble
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins1st,reserved,ins-2p2nd,swung 5w1/4,rallied,led late,out-nodded

ENTRY.NAME: Fearless Soldier
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable St Elias Stable and Gainesway Stable (Antony Beck)
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside,asked 1/2,chased 2p2nd turn,3p1/4,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Wico (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Andrew Farm and For the People Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,rated in 4th,2-3p2nd turn,4w into lane,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Mercante
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,2p1st,at rear,2-3p2nd,6w into lane,good energy

ENTRY.NAME: Harrington
ENTRY.COMMENT: moved in,2p1st,towards rear,2p2nd turn,3w1/4,no threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Coaching Club American Oaks - Grade1 SARATOGA RACE 9 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 97. Stakes Purse 500000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $500 each which should accompany the nomination; $3,500 to pass the entry box and an additional $4,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $2,500 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight, 121 lbs. Trophies will be presented to the winning owner, trainer, and jockey. Closed Saturday, July 8, 2023 with 16 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WET PAINT got bumped at the start when SOUTHLAWN recovered outwards from a stumble, raced along the inside through the first turn before taking to the two path down the backstretch settled unhurried at the tail of the field, came under coaxing just off the inside at the seven-sixteenths before tipping out slightly three wide midway on the turn, angled five wide into upper stretch under a drive, closed outside to issue a challenge inside the final furlong latching on a sixteenth from home, tussled through to the finish, had a mind to hop over the tracks of the starting gate and skipped through them before getting up in the final jumps to score. SACRED WISH forwardly placed just off the inside through the first turn, tracked the leader in closest aim three then two wide, came under coaxing near the five-sixteenths and advanced on the front to take over command just inside that station, swung three then two wide straightened away into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under growing threat to the outside and tussled head to head clinging to the front until caught in the final strides to the finish while well clear of the rest for the place honors. GAMBLING GIRL three wide through the first turn, raced three wide in pursuit from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch offering up a mild bid, then weakened in the final furlong while along for the show honors. SHE'S LOOKIN LUCKY coaxed from the start, established the front and showed the way in hand along the inside through sensible splits and under no pressure through the opening five furlongs, steadily came under increasing pressure into and through the far turn from SACRED WISH to the outside and was placed to coaxing near the five-sixteenths in response, got displaced from the front inside that station, spun just off the inside into upper stretch in retreat and weakened to the finish. SOUTHLAWN stumbled badly at the start pecking the ground and recovering outwards to bump with WET PAINT, chased along the inside just of the pace coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, angled three wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Southlawn
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled badly st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Wet Paint
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, 2-3w pursuit, angled 5w uppr, dug in, up last jumps

ENTRY.NAME: Sacred Wish
ENTRY.OWNER: Black Type Thoroughbreds Swinbank Stables Adkisson Steve Dunn Christopher T and
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p 1st turn, tracked 3-2w, up ins 5/16, 3-2w uppr, clear, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Gambling Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w 1st turn, 3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: She's Lookin Lucky
ENTRY.OWNER: Dunn Richard Ten Strike Racing Barber Gary Sussman Jeremy and Monken Todd
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, coaxed 5/16, yielded, 2w 1/4p, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 6F Dirt CR: 102. Allowance Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ACCRETIVE tracked the pace down the backstretch, engaged the leaders in the four path on the turn, was roused between foes in upper stretch, fought on even terms for the lead into the final furlong, shook clear under a right-handed crop outside the sixteenth-pole and extended the advantage to the wire under steady handling. BOURBON BASH settled at the rear of the field, started the turn in the two path, angled five wide outside the five-sixteenths, gained to make a bid outside the quarter-pole, spun six wide into the stretch, battled on even terms for the lead into the final furlong, lost touch with the winner outside the sixteenth-pole, swapped back to his inside lead shortly thereafter and proved no match while able to get the place. DAUFUSKIE ISLAND stumbled badly at the start but broke with his head in front, chased the pace down the backstretch, made a bid at the half-mile pole, took the lead in the three path inside the seven-sixteenths, spun four wide into the stretch under heavy pressure, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened but was clear for the show. A LA CARTE broke out at the start, was urged along on the outside, went five then six wide on the turn, dropped back to the five path into the stretch and lacked the needed response. BEZOS was hustled to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, lost the advantage while along the rail inside the seven-sixteenths, dropped back under a drive into the stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Bash
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled at rear,2p3/8,angled 5w5/16,bid1/4,6w,no match late

ENTRY.NAME: Bezos
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to front,pace,ins trn,headed outside3/8,drop back1/4,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Daufuskie Island
ENTRY.OWNER: Scuderi Vincent S Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R and Cotrone Robert
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled bad brk,chased,bid1/2,3p,lead out3/8,4p1/4,overtakn,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Accretive
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked,bid 4path turn,roused btwn3/16,clear ins1/8,steady urging

ENTRY.NAME: A La Carte
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,urged along outside,5-6wide turn,5w1/4,no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 11 6F Dirt CR: 101. Waiver Claiming Purse 60000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Du e At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SAINT SELBY dueled from the five path down the backstretch with CATCHYASOON to the inside, tucked to the two path into the turn and steadily shook off his main pace rival midway on the bend to slip away when spinning five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive coming under growing threat to the outside and drifted out three paths a furlong out before being corrected and engaging his main danger eye to eye inside that station, then repelled the challenge to inch away in the late stages and prevail. SEVEN NATION ARMY chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, rallied to issue a challenge a furlong from home, dug in latched on to the sixteenth marker, then got rebuffed through to the finish while running on clear for the place honors. SENOR JOBIM coaxed from the gate, chased four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the turn getting placed to coaxing with seven-sixteenths to go, swung four wide into upper stretch, stayed on same paced to the finish to procure the show honors. CATCHYASOON coaxed from the gate, dueled from the three path with SAINT SELBY to his outside down the backstretch, tucked inside through the turn and began to get shaken off midway, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and weakened. DIGITAL FUTURE coaxed from the gate, chased six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch and tired. JUST CALL RAY coaxed from the start, chased just off the inside until tucked inside into the turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch and tired. PRINCE JAMES seven paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and tired. AIR SHOW chased just off the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch and made no impact. STEINBECK a bit fractious in the gate prior to the start, chased eight paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking four wide through the turn, went eight wide at the top of the stretch and was no threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Catchyasoon
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled 3p, ins turn, coaxed 5/16, ins 1/4, weakened
